name: Hotel Pearl Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a gem on our stay. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are gorgeous and clean, the price is very reasonable, the rooftop restaurant is great and has fair prices as well.
reviews.title: Best managed hotel in Rajahstan

reviews.text: Our deluxe room had a romantic vibe which had a great impact on our libido ;)
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: This hotel is one of the best among budget hotels in india. The rooms are fairly spacious . The roof top resturant has wide menu. The hotel staffs and the owner mr singh are extremely helpful and courtacious . Also , Mr Salim who arranges taxi for local sight seeing and airport pick up drop was very helpful.
reviews.title: Even better as expected

reviews.text: I'm not sure how to express how good is this place. The rooms are very well aconditioned, with a complete bathroom, cool decoration and really clean (with very chic details, like the towels or the cleaning sign on he WC when you enter the room the first time). The lobby, the corridors and the common room are really cool and clean too. The rooftop restaurant... is something like paradise in Jaipur. The food is not only cheap and abundant, but probably the best in Jaipur (at least, in this price range). The lassi was the best I tasted in India! And the general atmosphere, specially in the restaurant, is gorgeous (music, fellow travellers, cool lighting...). The owner, Mr. Singh, and all his crew, are very professional and helpful.
reviews.title: best one in jaipur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think I will come back to Jaipur only to stay in this place again!
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel - book in advance

reviews.text: Pearl Palace is an excellent choice in Jaipur. The restaurant in the roof is fantastic (best veg thali we have had in India) and the prices are great. Good atmosphere and lots of other travellers around. We didn't feel the need to go into he town in he evening (nothing going in there anyway) as the roof terrace was so great.
reviews.title: Great choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a bit of a walk up to the main part if town and the traffic en route is completely mental but there are plenty of rickshaws to barter with outside the hotel and you can get them down to 50 rupees (60p) for a drop off in town.
reviews.title: Wifi not free!

reviews.text: The bedrooms are well equipped and above all squeaky clean, which isn't easy to come by in India. There is also a hotel round the corner which will let you use their pool for a small fee.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel!
A little bit whacky, a good choice for Jaipur
reviews.text: Mr Singh, the hotel owner has kindly put together a booklet on Jaipur which came in really handy and detailed a good walking tour. Nice touch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would absolutely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Good choice in Jaipur!

reviews.text: We only had one day/night here but it was excellent; arrived early morning from the train and they held our luggage and there was a place to shower and change. We had a an awesome breakfast in the rooftop restaurant. Very stylish but laid back with great staff. The front desk was most helpful and they give you a brochure called "Jaipur for Aliens" that has more information than you would think to ask for! The room was modern and clean and the water was hot. Good A/C comfy beds.
reviews.title: wish we could have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving at the hotel after a tiring journey from Delhi, we were beaming that this looked like a wonderful place. We were shown to our room soon enough and I can say we truly relaxed in a very clean room with fresh clean sheets. The staff was attentive and helpful when we asked for information at the reception. Whenever we got back to the hotel, the man at the reception made us feel very welcome. We met Mr. Singh in the evening although for a short time but he came across as a man truly in love with his profession.
reviews.title: Great value and lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely place with great ambience, we will surely recommend to anyone going to Jaipur
reviews.title: Best Budget Hotel in Jaipur

reviews.text: We had a double room which was really nice and very reasonable. The management were friendly we and even got a little book on the customs of India which was a really nice added touch. We loved the little restaurant on the roof too, great views of the surrounding areas.
reviews.title: Travellers hub

reviews.text: A great place to stay! We stayed for 3 nights in August in a triple room. Although the 3rd bed was a fold out, it was comfortable and the room was very clean. The staff were very helpful and the whole place has a good atmosphere. Internet access was good in the common room (not free though) and the rooftop restaurant is excellent. It does fill up with travellers so get up early in the evenings, we were there at the weekend and it was packed - but it is worth it! A friend recommended Pearl Palace to me and I'd definitely recommend to others.
reviews.title: Fab - book early!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not recommend this hotel enough. We stayed in the deluxe double room which served as a haven from bustling Jaipur. The staff are extremely helpful, the rooms are incredibly clean and well presented. The roof-top restaurant on top of this hotel is extremely popular with both passing diners and hotel patrons. It was by-far the best meal we had in India (and it's not expensive at all). Transport into Jaipur central is easy from the hotel as a series of auto-rickshaw drivers (sometimes unscrupulous) await to take you to your destination.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel and Restaurant!!

reviews.text: We stayed a couple of nights (end July) at Pearl Palace and we enjoyed the staying there. It was one of the best places and better priced for the value. Mr Singh was very kind with us and we appreciated both his suggestions and the hotel management. Rooms are clean and the personnel is willing to help. The roof restaurant is an experience to try and repeat, with great views, good food and relaxing atmosphere. During our trip we reminded often this place, comparing with the average we found elsewhere. Also we remind about Salim, that placed just outside the hotel, will try to organize your movements with any mean he has on hands. We confess to be initially wondering " is this one of the usual hassling people?" and we ended to follow his suggestions and even change part of our plans, without regrets. We discoveded Shekawati region and he was able to find us good and reasonably priced arrangements, with plenty of suggestions and trusted drivers. If we could only have find similar professionals in our trip........ In one word Bravo to all of you Cesare Rigo and family Chieri (Torino) Italy
reviews.title: Comments from an Italian family. Bravo Mr Singh & Bravo Salim!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting Jaipur. We booked on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews and Lonely Planet and were very happy with out choice.
reviews.title: Excellent room and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were very helpful and gave us a nice triple room. The room was the best we had in 6 weeks of travelling around India. Comfy beds, large bathroom and a clean well decorated room.
reviews.title: The Indian Pearl!

description: Centrally located in the land of the legendary Maharajas, Palaces and Forts, Hotel Pearl Palace is a first class budget priced hotel located in the heart of Rajasthan's rich cultural Heritage, "The Pink City" - Jaipur. We, as well as our staff, have created a friendly and courteous atmosphere that is truly special. We stand ready to serve our guests 24/7 and will provide all kinds of information regarding places of interest in and around the city.
